title: Ticket #4268: Some DAGMan tests are non-deterministic
description:
Some tests, for example job_dagman_halt-A are not 100% deterministic in that they rely on things like doing sleeps to order certain aspects of the test.

It seems like there are two basic approaches to this:

  1. Make the actual test execution totally deterministic
  2. Make the test checking tolerant of certain variations in execution order

To do option 1 we'd have to replace the sleeps with some kind of explicit waits that would only stop waiting once they verified that a certain condition was true.

To do option 2 we'd have to implement some kind of checking mechanism that could check for a partial order among certain output lines or something like that.
